page.title: 08 Buildings
page.content: Yardley Hastings is very old .It dates back to the Saxon times.The majority of the cottages are made from limestone which was dug from local quarries The roofs are made out of Pantiles or Slate or are Thatched and the interior walls are of wattle and daub.Most of the building materials were produced locally in the brick-yard at Castle Ashby.Since most of Yardley Hastings is within a conservation area difficulties arise from time to time, in obtaining such materials as matching pantiles ,when alterations or repairs are made to the buildings The oldest buildings in the village are the Church of St.Andrew which is late Norman (C12),and the Court Palour which is probably C14,and is now classed as an historical monument.
